paper_metadata.title: Effects of an Asset-Building Program in Rural Ghana

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: The relationship between social assets and SILC participation, though modest, is noteworthy and may suggest that by connecting vulnerable households to a social network, the SILC program has the potential to heighten the feeling of belongingness

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: bring together resources to enhance household financial assets

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Results of this study provide support for a positive association between SILC participation and outcome of interest to this study: social assets, psychosocial well-being, and financial well-being
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: Using a survey that was administered individually to respondents at set locations, this study examines the effects of participation in an asset-building program in resource-constrained households in rural Ghana (n = 120 in the experimental group and n = 120 in the comparison group)

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Results of this study provide support for a positive association between SILC participation and outcome of interest to this study
evidence_citations.country_citation: this study examines the effects of participation in an asset-building program in resource-constrained households in rural Ghana
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: this study examines the effects of participation in an asset-building program in resource-constrained households in rural Ghana
